climbs.name: Y'owl Don't Know (How Good You Have It)

content.description: Stem, layback, or jam your way up a short crack coming out of an alcove and gain a slab above.
content.location: The only finger/hand crack on the West wall, towards the right side.

content.description: Crux is a small bulge at the second bolt. Above that cruise up the low angle dihedral.
content.protection: 4 bolts, mussies at the anchor (shared with Owl Be Thy Name).
content.location: Right of the Owl Be Thy Name arete, look for a left facing dihedral.

content.description: Start at a small right facing corner. Cruise up towards the bulging roof. Clip a bolt above the lip and work up the right side through a cryptic sequence to pull onto the clean slab above.
content.location: Look for the prominent bulging roof to the right of the Owljazeera dihedral.

content.description: The best route at the West Face? Vertical pocket pulling gets you to crux lip and onto the slab arete above.
content.protection: 6 bolts, mussies at the anchor (shared with Owljazeera).
content.location: The left arete of the West Face.

content.description: Stick clip the chain draw. Crux (5.12-) is right off the deck. A second crux (5.11) guards the upper, easier slab.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Fixed draw on the first bolt (stick clip is mandatory). Mussies at the anchor. Easy to reach from the Owl Be Thy Name anchors.
content.location: On the northwest facing ledge accessed by 3rd class scrambling left from the other West Face routes.

content.description: Head up steep huecos for a few bolts, then step right onto the prominent arete.
content.location: Right of the West Face and the steep pillar. Traverse a short ledge to find the start at the white huecos.

content.description: A bolted steep crack. Sequence-y and pumpy.
content.location: On the northwest facing ledge accessed by 3rd class scrambling left from the other West Face routes.

content.description: This wall faces Mt Rose. Probably the only spot at Owl Rock that isn't super kid friendly due to the sloping and uneven base with cliff-fall potential. Late afternoon sun in the winter.
